title: permission denied, open '/root/.config/truffle/config.json'
body:
- [ ] I've asked for help in the [Truffle Gitter](http://gitter.im/Consensys/truffle) before filing this issue.

Didn't ask in gitter, all I see is a huge amount of questions unanswered and just broad disorder IMHO.

Actually I don't think v12 does solve this issue and I don't think this is a Node version-specific issue. It currently looks like if you use `sudo npm install -g truffle` you will get the error above due to permissions issues. For reference, the [configstore](https://github.com/yeoman/configstore) package is trying to access a file that is used to hold user configuration data. Perhaps there is some information about this in the configstore repo?

Plain honest the upgrade was the last thing I did, but there is certainly no track on my end of what else was done as many things were done. I would say take it with a grain of salt and just close it, if you wish I will hide/delete the fix post.

The solution at this [URL](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38323880/error-eacces-permission-denied
) worked for me. 

1. Back up your computer
2. On the command line, in your home directory, create a directory for global installations:
`mkdir ~/.npm-global`
3. Configure npm to use the new directory path:
`npm config set prefix '~/.npm-global'`
4. In your preferred text editor, open or create a ~/.profile file and add this line:
 `export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH`
5. On the command line, update your system variables:
`source ~/.profile`
6. To test your new configuration, install a package globally without using sudo:
`npm install -g jshint`

Alternatively, Instead of steps 2-4, you can use the corresponding ENV variable (e.g. if you don’t want to modify ~/.profile):

`NPM_CONFIG_PREFIX=~/.npm-global`

I think these kinds of errors are usually successfully resolved by installing npm with nvm. npm has [these recommendations](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally) for issues involving these types of problems. Hopefully someone might find it helpful.

Looking back into this issue i'd like to add two things:

- My initial statement on Gitter was just wrong. Tyler helps and has helped alot, props to him.
- Somewhere down the road I had read that instead of using ```sudo``` with npm commands was to use ```--unsafe-perm``` . Again I don't recall much about it, but mixing up nvm and npm alone on the fly can cause issues.

Ok thanks @thecircleoflifefree. We want to get to investigate and get to the bottom of this. Do you have any specific steps that might help us recreate this problem? If you do, it would be super helpful!

I could fix it cheating about the $HOME directory.

    set HOME_BACKUP=$HOME
    export HOME=/tmp/truffle_install
    mkdir -p $HOME/.config/truffle
    chmod a+rwx $HOME/.config               
    chmod a+rwx $HOME/.config/truffle     # <- install fails with EACCESS (dir doesn't exists)
    npm install -g truffle@${TRUFFLE_VERSION} # <- $HOME is ignored. Install in correct path
                                             # /opt/nvm/versions/node/v10.16.3/bin/truffle in my setup
    rm -rf $HOME   # <- I can remove it once installed. Weird!!!???
    set HOME=$HOME_BACKUP
